review_bomb_reason: Kurz nach Beginn des Russland-Ukraine-Krieges im Februar 2022 entschieden sich einige Spieleentwickler dazu, sich klar gegen Russland zu positionieren, indem sie entweder ihre Spiele nicht mehr in Russland zum Verkauf anboten, z.B. game_description: Learn the story behind Borderlands 2’s villain, Handsome Jack, and his ascendance to power in this new game in the Borderlands series. Taking place between the original Borderlands and Borderlands 2, the Pre-Sequel gives you a bunch of new gameplay featuring the genre fusion of shooter and RPG gameplay.
review:
After waiting for the release of this game, I was sorely disappointed. Borderlands The Pre-Sequel has ruined the franchise for me. It's a "AAA" game which feels and plays like an expansion of some sort.
 The whole space concept is just plain retarded and distasteful. The atmosphere and running along a giant red crater and then along the same looking crater except covered in ice really bored me within the first few hours. The whole oxygen thing is useless and a waste of design. Can't even use your vehicle to travel across the boring environment because the ramps they've set out to clear giant death cracks in the surface don't propel you enough distance to clear the gap! So you then end up getting out on foot, double jumping with your crappy oxygen pack and wait 20seconds to land back on the surface of the crappy crater.
 Seriously, this game was a major disappointment. Borderland fans, look past this game and save your cash. Serious waste of time.

affected_games: "Borderlands" - Serie: Borderlands (und GOTY - Editionen), Borderlands 2 und Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel
game_description: Discover the original co-op shooter-looter, crammed with new enhancements! As one of 4 trigger-happy mercenaries with RPG progression, equip bazillions of guns to take on the desert planet Pandora.
review:
[UPDATED REVIEW]
The game works and looks beautiful, the new map helps general navigation and the cleaner interface is a sign of just how old the original was, to those who have lost track of the years gone by, but that is all the good there is to say compared against the original.

Long standing issues:
Launcher circumvention being required in too many cases.
Default settings on minimum
Default settings freezing completely for performing at unforgivably low framerate
Needing to max out settings to somehow make framerates decent
Bugged character imports - scrambled quests and progression
Bugs with new characters somehow having all quests discovered right off the bus
Quest markers more often lead you away from objectives and then back again than just getting you where you need to be
Audio cutoffs randomly during dialogue sequences
Previously mentioned instability and memory leaks - first I couldn't see them happen because I couldn't play, now I notice them, too!
Removal of local network multiplayer functions, causing lag between players in the same building! Worst decision made for changes to this game! Seriously, how fucking blind were Blind Squirrel when making that choice?

I still cannot recommend it to anyone who didn't get it as an upgrade for free. Otherwise, have fun with the prettified visuals.

[OLD REVIEW]
If you are not a previous owner of Borderlands, don't bother getting it for at least a month or so.
In it's current state, it is riddled to the core with problems.
My experience is completely freezing my computer within 15 seconds of entering the main menu.
Many other people get hard crashes, freezes on launch, the game not loading, requiring convoluted workarounds to make the game launch (which I had before the freeze issue) and memory leaks galore!
People who can play frequently report frame issues, audio bugs and visuals messing up horribly.

Wait for a news update saying all of this is fixed. DO. NOT. BUY... Until this is done.

I will update this review when something changes.
